strings:
<se_low>Yangus: ...Blimey, it's quiet 'ere, eh? Too quiet.
I got ringin' in me jugs.
<se_low>Yangus: Phew, that Jug-o'-wotsit geezer packs a punch, eh? And that's before 'e's even 'ad a chance to wake up properly!
<se_low>Yangus: Still, there ain't no monster we ain't been able to beat yet, so why should this bloke be any diff'rent? Next time, we'll rip 'is flamin' 'orns off!
<se_low>Yangus: I, I don't believe it! That back-stabbin' Marcello, come to 'elp us out? I'd almost think it was a wind-up, but...
<se_low>Yangus: Well, 'e's back there right now, isn't 'e? Tryin' to put that 'orned 'ulk to bed all on 'is own. ...Nah, come on, we've gotta get back an' 'elp 'im out!

<se_low>Yangus: This place is still as creepy as ever, even if that Jug-o'-wotsit geezer's not 'ere no more.
...Brrr, yeah, it's creepy all right.
<se_high>Jessica: Where are we? What are we doing here?
<se_high>Jessica: ...Sorry. The, the atmosphere in this place just makes me so on edge.

<se_high>Jessica: Right, now I'm angry!
No one beats an Albert hollow like that!
<se_high>Jessica: Forget how creepy this place is! I'm done being scared! All I can think about now is defeating that oversized ram! Argh!
<se_high>Jessica: Um, hello? This is hardly the time for stepping outside to have a chit-chat, is it?
<se_high>Jessica: We've got to get straight back to Marcello and help him beat that Juggerwroth brute!
<se_high>Jessica: We've really got no reason to be here now that we've defeated that Juggerwroth brute, have we?
<se_def>Angelo: No looking back, <hero>. Let's push on. Don't ask why, let's just keep moving.
<se_def>Angelo: I'm not going to lie. The thought of facing that giant beast in his dank hole again does not appeal. But...
<se_def>Angelo: Argh, why is this getting to me so much?
<se_def>Angelo: I don't care that we were beaten by that horny devil. Or that he's sticking his oar in. I just can't stand this feeling that...

<se_def>Angelo: Hahhh... Come on.
Let's finish what we started.

<se_def>Angelo: Listen, I've got some thinking to be doing.
Do you mind if we chat later?

<se_high>Red: I've got one golden rule when it comes to
'unting out treasure: First sign o' trouble <endash>
first whiff o' somefin' dodgy, scram.
<se_high>Red: ........Yeah, this place reeks of dodge. If we was 'ere just to 'unt out treasure, I'd be back out that cave entrance so fast, ya wouldn't see me for dust!
<se_high>Red: I don't like Juggerwroth, or 'is creepy 'ideout. There's black magic at work, I'm tellin' ya.
<se_high>Red: Person'ly, I can't wait to finish 'im off and leave this place be'ind.
<se_high>Red: Blimey, I didn't see that one comin'. Who'd 'ave thought it'd be 'im of all people to show up an' 'elp us out, eh?
<se_high>Red: I dunno wot Marcello's playin' at, to be honest. Maybe it's just a case of me enemy's enemy is me friend, or summat. But let's not worry about it and just take the 'elp, eh?
<se_high>Red: I've picked up the bulk o' wot this cave 'as to offer now, so if we're done admirin' the view, let's get out of 'ere, eh?

<se_low>Morrie: Hmmm, no monsters come on these steps, ay?
Strange...
<se_low>Morrie: Ah ha ha! Si, this demon Juggerwroth is FANTASTICO! A potent monster! A MIGHTY monster!
<se_low>Morrie: If I could only persuade him to come in my monstrous pit... Hahhh, but he's not gonna listen to the discussione, ay?

<se_low>Morrie: No! No no no!
This is no time for conversazione!
<se_low>Morrie: First we go back to the young fratello and together we defeat the demon, THEN we take time for tea and biscotti, ay?

<se_low>Morrie: For some reason that I do not understand,
this place is making me lose my gusto.

<se_low>Morrie: I feel like something is on my shoulders. Something heavy. And I am hearing the thingies in my ears. ...Maybe I need a vacation, ay?
Ah ha ha!
